turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Russian ruble.
turn.1: What is the meaning of Russian ruble?
turn.2: Russian ruble The Russian ruble or rouble ( "rublʹ", plural: "rubli" ; sign: ₽, руб; code: RUB) is the currency of the Russian Federation, the two partially recognised republics of Abkhazia and South Ossetia and the two unrecognised republics of Donetsk and Luhansk.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The ruble is subdivided into 100 "kopeks" (sometimes written as "kopecks" or "copecks"; "kopeyka", plural: "kopeyki").
turn.5: What do you find most interesting about the article?
turn.6: The ruble was the currency of the Russian Empire and of the Soviet Union (as the Soviet ruble).
turn.8: However, today only Russia, Belarus and Transnistria use currencies with the same name.
turn.9: Is there any other information that is important?
turn.10: The ruble was the world's first decimal currency: it was decimalised in 1704 when the ruble became equal to 100 kopeks.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: In 1992 the Soviet ruble (code: SUR) was replaced with the Russian ruble (code: RUR) at the rate 1 SUR = 1 RUR.
